actions.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended).
Reported to House (Amended) by House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries.  Report No: 97-275.
Placed on House Calendar No: 26.
Called up by House on Call of Private Calendar.
Passed House (Amended) by Unanimous Consent.
Received in the Senate, read twice, and referred to the Committee on Commerce.
Committee on Commerce. Ordered to be reported with an amendment in the nature of a substitute favorably.
Committee on Commerce. Reported to Senate by Senator Packwood with an amendment in the nature of a substitute and an amendment to the title. Without written report.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under Regular Orders. Calendar No. 596.
Passed Senate with an amendment and an amendment to the Title by Voice Vote.
Executive Comment Received From DOT.
House Agreed to Senate Amendments by Unanimous Consent.
Cleared for White House.
Measure Signed in Senate.
Presented to President.
Signed by President.
Became Private Law No: 97-27.

official_title: An act to direct the Secretary of the department in which the United States Coast Guard is operating to cause the vessel Sky Lark to be documented as a vessel of the United States so as to be entitled to engage in the coastwise trade, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Directs the Secretary of the department in which the United States Coast Guard is operating to document a named vessel as a vessel of the United States entitled to engage in the coastwise trade.

titles.title: A bill to direct the Secretary of the department in which the United States Coast Guard is operating to cause the vessel Sky Lark to be documented as a vessel of the United States so as to be entitled to engage in the coastwise trade.

An act to direct the Secretary of the department in which the United States Coast Guard is operating to cause the vessel Sky Lark to be documented as a vessel of the United States so as to be entitled to engage in the coastwise trade, and for other purposes.
